title: Taylor Swift is a Broadchurch fan and we're honestly shaken
text:
Taylor Swift outed herself as a ‘massive’ Broadchurch fan and we don’t even know where to begin with this information.

The You Need To Calm Down singer made a surprise appearance in Wednesday night’s documentary Children In Need: Got It Covered, which saw a star-studded line up of British actors record covers of their favourite songs for charity.

Organising the album was actor Shaun Dooley, a self-proclaimed Swiftie who decided to perform a version of Taylor’s 2010 album track Never Grow Up in dedication to his family.

With the help of Shaun’s Broadchurch co-star Olivia Colman, who by some mad six degrees of separation connection had worked with Taylor’s actor boyfriend Joe Alwyn on The Favourite, a plot was hatched to get the 29-year-old actress down to Abbey Road Studios (where the group was recording) to surprise Shaun.

‘Shaun Dooley is recording a Taylor Swift song and Taylor Swift goes out with a very fellow, Joe Alwyn, who I did a job with,’ Olivia explained.

‘I did a very cheeky [thing], texted him, went, “Do you think Taylor will come along and surprise Shaun Dooley?” It was a stab in the dark, will it ever happen but apparently she’s coming. I’m so excited.’

Taylor surprised Shaun… (Picture: BBC)

Meeting up with Taylor backstage, the ecstatic Olivia gave Taylor a fair bit of warning of just how much her being there would mean to Shaun.

‘He doesn’t know you’re coming and he might wee,’ Olivia said, with an unfazed Taylor replying: ‘We can do cleanups, this is taped.’

…Thanks to his Broadchurch co-star Olivia (Picture: BBC)

Naturally surprising Shaun, the duo reunited, with Taylor confessing: ‘I’m a big Broadchurch fan, by the way. Massive.’

This is what dating a British guy does to you…

The actress’s comment prompted incredulous laughter (can you blame him?) from Shaun, who played villain Ricky Gillespie in the second series, reassuring Taylor: ‘I’m not as nasty in real life.’

Well, there’s a crossover we didn’t ever really expect to see.

Earlier on in the episode, Olivia put in another celebrity favour, roping in her Fleabag co-star Phoebe Waller-Bridge to help her on her own track.

‘Olivia Colman has just sent two texts and got Taylor Swift and Phoebe Waller-Bridge to rock up. The clowns I hang out with can’t even reply the same day,’ one fan joked.

Olivia’s power is truly unbeatable.

Children In Need: Got It Covered is available to purchase on Friday 1 November.
